content: Very good app.

License check paranoya: it keeps checking... Also cash problem. O.k., if your cash is huuuge, trick: go to Android/Data/com.facebook.rethinkvision.Bimostitch/Files... Delete this folder manually in order to have clean cash. (My App Manager doesn't count this folder as cash, so I can't clear it by regular "Clear cash" button).
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback. The app is supposed to automatically delete temp files when stitching is completed.

And it's supposed to only occasionally check for license.

content: Creates high quality full-resolution quality panoramas from photos taken in another app. It doesn't seem as limited by device RAM as camera apps that attempt to create panoramas on the fly. It also gives you more control over their creation.

content: This app would have much better reviews if 1/3 of the negative reviews weren't written by idiots. very simple to use, just check the settings to make sure you get the results you want. feedback: 1) would be nice to be able to pause current panorama, sometimes if I'm making a large pano I have to wait the whole time to use my phone again because it gets too laggy while processing. 2) let me queue panorama for a set time in the future, in 1 hour for example 3) let me set preview quality

content: Fantastic App, thanks so much dev.
Like Magic!

Was great on my Note 4 but I have today upgraded to a Note 20 Ultra and can now only view my results in portrait mode unless I switch to 3D. For some reason rotating the device does not rotate the image. Screen rotation is set to on and the rest of the images in my Gallery all display and rotate fine. This only happens within the app. Viewing from the Gallery app they are fine. Is this a bug? Aside from this issue the app is great üëç üëå. Apologies if it's me being thick.

False Claims. Pro version does NOT "maintain quality of source photos", as clearly stated in the description. A dozen images, each with a resolution of 5148x3456 created a stitched resolution of 5228x2286. The stitching function actually works great, but this kind of quality reduction is unacceptable.
replyContent: You must have left the max resolution setting on default 12 MP max output. Check the full app functionality before making making false claims.

content: This app used to work pretty well, and could create huge panoramas by stitching multiple shots together. Appernetly they messed with the algorithm and now you can only do two pics at a time. Even with the pro version. Don't waste ypur time or money.
Awesome, best panorama ever. Great app, money well spent.

Free version does a better job at stitching than the paid version. I paid for the app to get color correction and same-as-source final image quality, but now the stitching is garbage because the specific setting that worked with my photos is removed in favor of an advanced feature which doesn't work.
Couldn't live without it!
Works great! Way better than google photos inconsistent auto panorama creation. Works excellent with Enhanced HDR+ images also.
Easy, useful for my location scouting.
Amazing result
It works, mostly.

Nice app with some quality issues. Stitch line in the free version actually seems better hidden than in paid version. 360 files does not play in viewers always. In-built viewer needs lots of improvements.

This app fills a gap in the android camera app. Being able to generate from video is a lovely feature. Being able to turn photos into a 3d model afterwards is a nice feature. I got it primarily because I wished to stitch telephoto camera images together which the default android app won't do. It is not as clean in stitching as the android app that comes with the Pixel 4 unless you're careful, but it does a great job of working out which image goes where. Preview prior to render is a great.
Awful results,waste of money

content: I must recommend AGAINST purchasing this app. The stitched photos were randomly uneven and highly pixelated. Not reflective of the originals. I opted for the for-pay "pro" version. Bad choice.
Best app in the Google Play Store... Does what it says and fast. I use to stitch panoramas from multiple photos taken with my drone.

Great pano stitcher app! use in combination with "A Better Camera App" in HDR mode for the best results! Tip: ALWAYS rotate around the lens, DON'T rotate YOUR entire device around your body or nothing will line up and the final composite image will render with a lot of artifacts if it even detects any overlap at all. This is the most common mistake that people new to panoramas make. This combination reminds me of the Hugin Panorama Creator I used to use in Linux, but much more automated!

Complete garbage application, the majority of the time it can't find a panorama in the image set, even though there are excellent matches frame to frame. Haven't been able to get a panorama from any video. I've had 6 year old phones that can do the job that this app can't seem to pull off. Waste of money!

content: The best best. From far. Change my mind. It can make panorama up to 360. It can do it in any direction, just avoid the parallax and try to keep as much as u can your lens in the same place in space. To avoid brightness differences in the panorama, when you take your photos: tap on your screen (like to focus/take a shoot) and hold until if shows "AE and AF locked". You should now have the same parameters for every next shoot. This app is really amazing and I succeeded to produce up to 70mpx pano

content: Would rate this higher but was shocked to find that this paid for app would not start without an Internet connection since it checks the licence at startup. I'm all for checking the licence at first startup, but once that's done could you not add a code in the data or elsewhere to certify the app for future starts.  After discussing my problem with the developper I am upgrading my review to 4. It would be 5 if it was not for this inconvenience  It seems that licence validation is cached at initialization and whenever you don't use the app for an extended period of time.   I guess I had not used the app for quite a while and I was on vacation in the wilderness and it wanted to connect to the Internet for licence validation.  Now that I am aware of this I will try to remember to run the app before leaving for vacation in the wilderness.   I would like to mention that the developer is  attentive to user comments   and that the app is very useful indeed.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback.
